description:
This protocol outlines our bacteriophage/virus taxonomy analyses. This analysis includes profiles for the average order relative abundance for each site, the phage species relative abundance profiles for each patient, and the relative abundance of specific species between sites. Intermediate files are also included with the publication, and the paths are specified below. Based on the methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

collections.protocol_name: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome
collections.protocol_name_html: The Human Skin dsDNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and its Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome

authors: HANNIGAN GD, GRICE EA, ET AL.

components.data: Here we need to reformat the mapping files. This means only looking at the two time points for which we have a complete data set (we have only partial data for time point 1), as well as excluding the sites and subjects for which we only have partial sampling (c(“Ba”,“Ph”,“Vf”,“Neg”)).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Here we need to reformat the mapping files. This means only looking at the two time points for which we have a complete data set (we have only partial data for time point 1), as well as excluding the sites and subjects for which we only have partial sampling (c(“Ba”,“Ph”,“Vf”,“Neg”)).

source_data.name:
SUBSET_MAP <- INPUT_MAP[which(INPUT_MAP$TimePoint %in% c(2,3)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$Site_Symbol %in% c("Ba","Ph","Vf","Neg")), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID %in% c(2,3,9,11)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID %in% NA), ]

components.data: Now we can easily plot the viral and phage order relative abundance information by skin site. Get a vector of the sample IDs that we want to pull out for analysis.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now we can easily plot the viral and phage order relative abundance information by skin site. Get a vector of the sample IDs that we want to pull out for analysis.

source_data.name:
KEEP_SAMPLES <- as.vector(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_ORDER[which(INPUT_ORDER$V3 %in% c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]

components.data: For this analysis we are removing those contigs which did not have a hit. We are only look at those contigs with phage/virus hits.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For this analysis we are removing those contigs which did not have a hit. We are only look at those contigs with phage/virus hits.

source_data.name:
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_SUBSET[-which(INPUT_SUBSET$V1 %in% c("No_hit")), ]
INPUT_MERGE <- merge(INPUT_SUBSET, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="V3", by.y="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")

components.data: These variables are called species but they are only named this. They really contain the order information.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: These variables are called species but they are only named this. They really contain the order information.

source_data.name: SPECIES_MEAN <- ddply(INPUT_MERGE, c("Site_Symbol","V1"), summarise, mean = mean(V2))

components.data: Also filter out those taxa that account for less than 0.5% of the mean relative abundance.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Also filter out those taxa that account for less than 0.5% of the mean relative abundance.

source_data.name:
MeanForExclusion <- ddply(SPECIES_MEAN, c("V1"), summarise, mean = mean(mean))
MeanForExclusion$Percent <- 100 * MeanForExclusion$mean / sum(MeanForExclusion$mean)
MeanForExclusionCut <- MeanForExclusion[c(MeanForExclusion$Percent > 0.5),]

components.data: Now only use the filtered taxa.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now only use the filtered taxa.

source_data.name: SpeciesMeanFiltered <- SPECIES_MEAN[c(SPECIES_MEAN$V1 %in% MeanForExclusionCut$V1),]

components.data: Take a look at the data frame.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take a look at the data frame.

source_data.name: head(SpeciesMeanFiltered)

components.data: Plot the results.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plot the results.

source_data.name: ggplot(SpeciesMeanFiltered, aes(x=Site_Symbol, y=mean, group=V1, fill=V1)) + theme_bw() + geom_bar(stat="identity", position="fill")

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Now that we have looked at the information for taxonomic order, we also want to look at the species level. Here we are only going to look at the top 10 taxa, and include the remaining taxa relative abundance information as “Other”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now that we have looked at the information for taxonomic order, we also want to look at the species level. Here we are only going to look at the top 10 taxa, and include the remaining taxa relative abundance information as “Other”.

source_data.name:
#Same formatting and parsing as above
KEEP_SAMPLES <- as.vector(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID)
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_SPECIES[which(INPUT_SPECIES$V3 %in% c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_SUBSET[-which(INPUT_SUBSET$V1 %in% c("No_hit")), ]
INPUT_MERGE <- merge(INPUT_SUBSET, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="V3", by.y="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
#*
SPECIES_MEAN <- ddply(INPUT_MERGE, c("Site_Symbol","V1"), summarise, mean = mean(V2))

components.data: Get the top ten taxa so we can specifically look at them.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get the top ten taxa so we can specifically look at them.

source_data.name:
TOP_TEN_MEAN <- ddply(SPECIES_MEAN, c("V1"), summarise, mean = mean(mean))
TOP_TEN_ORDER <- TOP_TEN_MEAN[c(order(TOP_TEN_MEAN$mean, decreasing=TRUE)),]
TOP_TEN <- TOP_TEN_ORDER[c(1:10),]
KEEP_TOP_TEN <- as.vector(TOP_TEN$V1)
#*
FINAL_TOP_TEN <- INPUT_MERGE[which(INPUT_MERGE$V1 %in% c(KEEP_TOP_TEN)), ]
FINAL_OTHER <- INPUT_MERGE[-which(INPUT_MERGE$V1 %in% c(KEEP_TOP_TEN)), ]
FINAL_OTHER$V3 <- factor(FINAL_OTHER$V3)

components.data: Get the rest of the relative abundance taxa into the "other" category.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get the rest of the relative abundance taxa into the "other" category.

source_data.name:
FINAL_OTHER_SUM <- data.frame(tapply(FINAL_OTHER$V2, INDEX=list(FINAL_OTHER$V3), FUN=sum))
FINAL_OTHER_SUM$SampleID <- c(row.names(FINAL_OTHER_SUM))
colnames(FINAL_OTHER_SUM) <- c("V2", "V3")
FINAL_OTHER_SUM$V2 <- as.numeric(as.character(FINAL_OTHER_SUM$V2))
FINAL_OTHER_SUM$V1 <- "Other"
FINAL_OTHER_SUM_FORMAT <- FINAL_OTHER_SUM[,c(2,3,1)]
FINAL_OTHER_MERGE <- merge(FINAL_OTHER_SUM_FORMAT, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="V3", by.y="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")
TOTAL_FINAL <- rbind(FINAL_TOP_TEN, FINAL_OTHER_MERGE)
head(TOTAL_FINAL)[,c(1:4)]

components.data:
## V3   V1   V2   NexteraXT_SampleID
## 21 MG100195   Multiple   6.39256e+03   MG100171
## 49 MG100195   Mycobacterium_phage   1.31141e+02   MG100171
## 57 MG100195   Propionibacterium_phage   1.69708e+00   MG100171
## 81 MG100195   Pseudomonas_phage   1.16539e+05   MG100171
## 85 MG100195   Streptococcus_phage   1.36360e+02   MG100171
## 87 MG100195   Human_papillomavirus   1.89501e+03   MG100171
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result:

## 49 MG100195   Mycobacterium_phage   1.31141e+02   MG100171
## 57 MG100195   Propionibacterium_phage   1.69708e+00   MG100171
## 81 MG100195   Pseudomonas_phage   1.16539e+05   MG100171

## 87 MG100195   Human_papillomavirus   1.89501e+03   MG100171

components.data: Order according to relative abundance.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Order according to relative abundance.

source_data.name:
TOP10_WITH_OTHER <- ddply(TOTAL_FINAL, c("V1"), summarise, mean=mean(V2))
TOP10_WITH_OTHER <- TOP10_WITH_OTHER[!c(TOP10_WITH_OTHER$V1=="Other"),]
TOP10_WITH_OTHER <- TOP10_WITH_OTHER[order(TOP10_WITH_OTHER$mean, decreasing=TRUE), ]
ORDER_MEAN_NAMES_WITH_OTHER <- as.vector(TOP10_WITH_OTHER$V1)

components.data: Append other to the vector.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Append other to the vector.

source_data.name:
ORDER_MEAN_NAMES_WITH_OTHER <- c(ORDER_MEAN_NAMES_WITH_OTHER, "Other")
TOTAL_FINAL$V1 <- factor(TOTAL_FINAL$V1, levels=c(ORDER_MEAN_NAMES_WITH_OTHER))

components.data: Get plotting of species by patient for graphing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get plotting of species by patient for graphing.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 18 of Script R4: Virome Taxonomy
source_data.annotation: The colors and other minor cosmetics can be fixed in illustrator.
source_data.thread_text: The colors and other minor cosmetics can be fixed in illustrator.
source_data.body: The colors and other minor cosmetics can be fixed in illustrator.

source_data.name: ggplot(TOTAL_FINAL, aes(x=factor(SubjectID), y=V2, fill=V1, order=V1)) + theme_bw() + geom_bar(stat="identity", position="fill") + facet_grid(TimePoint~Site_Symbol, scales="free") + scale_fill_manual(values=c("purple","pink","green","blue","lightblue","yellowgreen", "black","grey","red","orange", "darkblue")) + theme(legend.position="right")

components.name: Expected result

components.data: We are also interested in some specific viral species relative abundances by site, after looking at the general subject profiles above. Here we look at the specific relative abundances of HPV, propionibacterium phages, and staphylococcus phages. First format the data. Get a list of the sample names.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We are also interested in some specific viral species relative abundances by site, after looking at the general subject profiles above. Here we look at the specific relative abundances of HPV, propionibacterium phages, and staphylococcus phages. First format the data. Get a list of the sample names.

components.data: First we looked at the relative abundances of Staphylococcus phages. This is written as a set of copy/pasted script sections for taxonomic group.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: First we looked at the relative abundances of Staphylococcus phages. This is written as a set of copy/pasted script sections for taxonomic group.

source_data.name:
STAPH_REL_ABUND <- REL_ABUND_MELT[c(REL_ABUND_MELT$Taxa=="Staphylococcus_phage"), ]
STAPH_MERGE <- merge(STAPH_REL_ABUND, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="variable", by.y="NexteraXT_Virome_SampleID")

components.data: Plot the data by occlusion status.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plot the data by occlusion status.

source_data.name: ggplot(STAPH_MERGE, aes(x=Occlusion, y=value)) + theme_bw() + geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE) + scale_y_log10() + ggtitle("Staphylococcus_phage")

components.data: ## Warning in loop_apply(n, do.ply): Removed 1 rows containing non-finite values (stat_boxplot).
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result: ## Warning in loop_apply(n, do.ply): Removed 1 rows containing non-finite values (stat_boxplot).

components.data: Perform stats using the kruskalmc subroutine.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform stats using the kruskalmc subroutine.

source_data.name:
STAPH_MERGE$Occlusion <- factor(STAPH_MERGE$Occlusion)
kruskalmc(STAPH_MERGE$value, STAPH_MERGE$Occlusion)

components.data:
## Multiple comparison test after Kruskal-Wallis
## p.value: 0.05
## Comparisons

  obs.dif   critical.dif   difference
Exposed-Intermittently_Occluded 10.76401   36.09383   FALSE
Exposed-Occluded 44.70092   23.71043   TRUE
Intermittently_Occulded-Occluded 55.46493   34.98437   TRUE
components.name: Expected result

source_data.result:

source_data.description: Run the stats.

source_data.name:
HPV_MERGE$Site_Categories <- factor(HPV_MERGE$Site_Categories)
kruskalmc(HPV_MERGE$value, HPV_MERGE$Site_Categories)
